briefTitle: A Study to Assess the Cholesterol Lowering Effect of Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Combination Tablet Compared to Another Cholesterol Lowering Drug in Elderly Patients With High Cholesterol at High or Moderately High Risk for Coronary Heart Disease (0653A-128)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient has a cholesterol level of 130 mg/dL or greater
* Patient is willing to maintain a cholesterol lowering diet for as long as they are in the study
* Patient is at moderate high risk or high risk for coronary heart disease per the National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel III (NCEP ATPIII) guidelines

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient weighs less than 100 lbs
* Patient has an allergy to ezetimibe, simvastatin or atorvastatin

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C) at Week 12
Percentage of Patients Who Achieved LDL-C <70 mg/dL at Week 12
Percentage of Patients Without Atherosclerosis Vascular Disease (AVD) Who Achieved LDL-C <100 mg/dL or Patients With AVD Who Achieved LDL-C <70 mg/dL at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients with AVD Who Achieved LDL-C \<70 mg/dL. AVD was defined as a history of myocardial infarction, stable angina, coronary artery procedures or evidence of clinically significant myocardial ischemia.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved LDL-C <100 mg/dL at Week 12
Percentage of Patients With High Risk for CHD Who Achieved LDL-C <70 mg/dL at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Risk was assessed utilizing a history of established CHD or CHD risk equivalent and Framingham Risk scoring.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients With AVD Who Achieved LDL-C <70 mg/dL at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients with AVD Who Achieved LDL-C \<70 mg/dL. AVD was defined as a history of myocardial infarction, stable angina, coronary artery procedures or evidence of clinically significant myocardial ischemia.
